issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.summary: CommonJS Modules - error in production using require()
fields.environment: IOS, Titanium Studio 1.0.5, sdk 1.7.1, sdk 1.7.3 and sdk 1.8.0

comments.body:
Daniel

Would you please edit your ticket to use the formatting markup provided, and include the platform you are using, the platform SDK version, and the Titanium SDK build dates/hashes?

Then we can progress this ticket.

Thanks

Daniel

Again, if you *edit* your ticket to include the information (rather than post to comments) I will be happy to move it across.

Actually, this issue is common to both iOS and Android, so I have a feeling that it may be due to tooling. I will investigate this with the core team.

When you are ready to improve the ticket, you are welcome to reopen.

Cheers

Hello,

sorry i don't understand what i have to include more. i edited the ticket whit more information in Environment:

IOS, Titanium Studio 1.0.5, sdk 1.7.1, sdk 1.7.3 and sdk 1.8.0

Thanks
Cheers

Daniel

Sorry for the confusion with this ticket. Our review process is clearer now, so your next ticket will hopefully be a little easier.

There have been a lot of fixes in the latest release relating to require(). It should work correctly now.
As you say anyway, this ticket duplicates TIMOB-5123. Hence, I will close it.

Thanks for your input.

Hello

no problem Paul Dowsett, I've tested and its working great.

Thanks
Daniel

Closing due to inactivity. If this issue still exists, please raise a new ticket, including all the information in the [JIRA Ticket Checklist|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/How+to+Submit+a+Bug+Report#HowtoSubmitaBugReport-JIRATicketChecklist] to ensure that we can escalate it quickly. Read [How to Submit a Bug Report|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/How+to+Submit+a+Bug+Report] if you have not read it before, and always start a ticket using the [JIRA Ticket Template|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/JIRA+Ticket+Template].

Thanks in advance
